pulltitle: Add Mozilla Code of Conduct
pullsbody:
Fixes #82


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_
pull_repo_desc: DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE THIS. Firefox Accounts relier JavaScript library
pull_commit_message:
Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #82.

_(Message COC002)_

pulltitle: fix(node): Fix the amd-loader when loading es6-promise
pullsbody:
es6-promise saw that `global.define` was defined and tried
to export itself using AMD instead of the expected CommonJS
format.

While loading CommonJS modules, remove `global.define` so modules
do not attempt to export using AMD, then add global.define back when
complete.

@vladikoff - Adds on to your PR.
pull_repo_desc: DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE THIS. Firefox Accounts relier JavaScript library
pull_commit_message:
fix(node): Fix the amd-loader when loading es6-promise

es6-promise saw that `global.define` was defined and tried
to export itself using AMD instead of the expected CommonJS
format.

While loading CommonJS modules, remove `global.define` so modules
do not attempt to export using AMD, then add global.define back when
complete.

pulltitle: fix: Simplify message serialization to the iframe.
pullsbody:
@zaach - could you review this?

No longer use `!!!` as the separator between the command and data. Instead, just send a serialized object with the `command` and `data` fields.
pull_repo_desc: DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE THIS. Firefox Accounts relier JavaScript library
pull_commit_message:
fix: Simplify message serialization to the iframe.

No longer use `!!!` as the separator between the command and data. Instead, just send a serialized object with the `command` and `data` fields.

pulltitle: feat: Reliers can set the lightbox background and zIndex.
pullsbody:
Example usage:

``` js
var relierClient = new FxaRelierClient(<client_id>);
relierClient.auth.signIn({
  state: <state>,
  scope: 'profile',
  redirectUri: <redirect_uri>,
  ui: 'lightbox',
  zIndex: 20000,
  background: '#000'
})
```

fixes #38
fixes #39
pull_repo_desc: DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE THIS. Firefox Accounts relier JavaScript library
pull_commit_message:
feat: Reliers can set the lightbox background and zIndex.

Example usage:
```js

relierClient.auth.signIn({
  state: <state>,
  scope: 'profile',
  redirectUri: <redirect_uri>,

  zIndex: 20000,
  background: '#000'
})
```

fixes #38

pulltitle: feat: Add the .token and .profile namespaces.
pullsbody:
See https://github.com/mozilla/fxa-oauth-server/blob/master/docs/api.md
- Move the `auth` namespace from FxaRelierClient.js to client/auth/api.js
- The XHR module uses micrajax to do the actual XHR requests. In theory this should also be compatible with node using the xhr2 module. I have not yet tested this.
- Add a responder addon that makes setting up sinon responses super simple.
- Remove the comment about `force_email`

fixes #16
pull_repo_desc: DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE THIS. Firefox Accounts relier JavaScript library
pull_commit_message:
feat: Add the .token and .profile namespaces.

See https://github.com/mozilla/fxa-oauth-server/blob/master/docs/api.md

* Move the `auth` namespace from FxaRelierClient.js to client/auth/api.js
* The XHR module uses micrajax to do the actual XHR requests. In theory this should also be compatible with node using the xhr2 module. I have not yet tested this.
* Add a responder addon that makes setting up sinon responses super simple.
* Remove the comment about `force_email`

fixes #16

pulltitle: fix(client): Redirect to the oauth server instead of the content server.
pullsbody:
The OAuth API contract specifies the user is first redirected to the OAuth server, then to the Content server. Honor this contract.

fixes #13
pull_repo_desc: DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE THIS. Firefox Accounts relier JavaScript library

pulltitle: feat(client): add `auth.forceAuth` to use the /oauth/force_auth endpoint on the content server.
pullsbody:
Remove the `force_email` parameter to signIn. This now mirrors how the OAuth and Content servers work.

Includes #17 
Fixes #18
pull_repo_desc: DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE THIS. Firefox Accounts relier JavaScript library
pull_commit_message:
feat: Reliers can specify an email and disable cached creds.

A relier can specify an `email` parameter used to pre-fill the email field in the content server. Specifying `email=blank` will disable cached credentials.

fixes #15
